result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Helsell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

3 mo conditional jail time.  To be served consecutively to the 6 months conditional time in 15CM16. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Attend and pay for alcohol counseling or treatment.

No contact with Thomas Salisbury.

Pay costs but not the DNA surcharge.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.




Concurrent with: 15CM16

timeConds.notes:
With huber but no good time.  To be served consecutively to the conditional jail time in 15CM16.  No credit for time served to be used on the conditional time.
Consecutive to: 15CM16 conditional jail time

ADDRESS INFO for Brian K. Helsell
Current: c/o Tom and Donna Carlson, 18825 County Hwy B, Lone Rock, WI 53556 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2015)
Prior: 28825 County Highway B, Lone Rock, WI 53556
One doc. filed in two cases (15CM16 & 15CM17). Entered into both and stored in 15CM16.

Defendant Brian K. Helsell in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 2 cases called together for status:  15CM16 and 15CM17.  DA informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution.  Proceeding with a plea/sentencing hearing, DA states the parties' recommendation:  15CM16 - jt recommendation calls for 2 years probation with condition time of 6 months on count 1/battery and no condition time on count 2.  In 15CM17 - DA states the agreement to be for a plea to the bail jumping charge for 2 years probation with condition time.  Conditions of probation:  Absolute sobriety, AODA and treatment, no contact with TS, costs, and 36 days credit.  DA states this recommendation is consistent with request of the victim.

15CM16 - Def pleads no contest to both counts.
15CM17 - Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Counsel and Def address the Court.  

Court rules on sentence:

15CM16 - Sentence withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  6 mo conditional time on Count 1.  No conditional time on Count 2.  15CM17 - Sentence withheld with 3 mo conditional time, consecutive to 15CM16's conditional time.  No good time on this conditional time.  No credit for time served to be entered on the conditional time, only to be used in event of revocation.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Have AODA asst and follow through with recommendation.  Conditions of probation to include some type of alcohol counseling or treatment (engage in, pay for).  No contact with TS.  Pay costs but not DNA surcharge.  Credit:  36 days jail time (in the event of revocation) on 15CM17/bail jumping case.

phone call from Atty. L - requests change in March 9th status date as DA has indicated she is not available; clerk resets to March 12th at 1:30; DA's office confirms availability of the prosecutor that date/time

15CM16 and 15CM17/status in both.  Defendant Brian K. Helsell appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Brian K. Helsell.  Atty. L states that offer hasn't been exchanged yet; asks for adjournment of this status.  Court moves these matters to March 9th at 11.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brian K. Helsell in custody in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def waives formal reading of the complaint. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties NG pleas entered for def.  Defense counsel requests status conference scheduling.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Brian K. Helsell via video from RC jail with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre.  Jennifer M. Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Longacre waives formal reading of complaint. Court informs def of charges/max possible penalties. Atty L. request matters be setover.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
